info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 31 at 8:56PM MST until July 31 at 10:00PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR WEST CENTRAL MOHAVE COUNTY... At 856 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Temple Bar Campground, Pierce Ferry And Antares Roads, Meadview and Temple Bar. This includes the following roads... Temple Bar Road between mile markers 4 and 26. Pierce Ferry Road between mile markers 18 and 40. Stockton Hill Road between mile markers 39 and 43. Antares Road between mile markers 29 and 32. Diamond Bar Road between mile markers 1 and 2. This includes the following streams and drainages... Salt Spring Wash, Colorado River, White Elephant Wash, Cane Spring Wash, Fox Canyon Wash, Truxton Wash, Grapevine Wash, Trail Rapids Wash, Detrital Wash and Hualapai Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
